FuncDef:
The user-group-queue command creates a GQ and displays the user group view.
The undo user-group-queue command removes a use group view.
By default, The device supports up to 8191 GQs.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a GQ.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Indicates the priority mode. After priority-mode is specified, priority-based shaping is configured for a GQ.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To create a GQ, run the user-group-queue command. If priority-mode is not specified, GQ-based shaping is configured. If priority-mode is specified, GQ-based shaping and priority-specific shaping are configured.
Configuration Impact
If the GQ specified by the group-name does not exist, the system creates a new GQ.
If the GQ specified by the group-name exists, the system enters the view of the GQ and then you can modify parameters of the queue.
Precautions
The user group queue that has been used cannot be deleted.
